name: Thalassa Boutique Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: wanted a week getaway with daughter, adults only and wanted spa. the hotel is lovely, pool wonderful and poolboy brilliant always helpful and looked after us well, towels changed twice daily if needed, pool waiters were great although couple day had different ones and had to keep going to bar for juices etc.... food ok not 5* and quite repetative, the fish restaurant isnt worth the money, infact the prices for drinks are way over the top, we had 2 bottles water daily and our bar bill was horrendous along with iced baileys coffee which was amazing!!!!! by pool. the room was a suite although was two rooms with doorway made through, 2 bathrooms, the towels were like sandpaper, we had pool view which was lovely, and the bar area at night was candlelite which was great and relaxing. a very chilled out place, the spa treatments were great we had whole package and loved it. I would go again but just watch bar tab!!!!!! I do feel rating should be changed to 4*.
reviews.title: loved it but not 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Thalassa Boutique hotel was a great experience. It is situated in a great location and in our case we had a room on the top floor at the southern end of the building with a view of some wonderful sunsets. Stavros, the Cypriot with an English accent, was always attentive and anxious to please. The room was clean and bright and there was a good sized balcony. I have a couple of complaints though - there were no cushions on the wooden chairs on the balcony for our room and secondly there was a musty smell in the room emanating from the bathroom, probably from mildew. The location was close to Coral Bay village where there were a number of good value restaurants. Unfortunately I cannot recommend eating in the hotel restaurant. We did this one night and found it expensive and the food mediocre. We had a car but there was a good bus service from close to the hotel with good access to Paphos town and the habour at Kato Paphos. Geerally we were very pleased with our experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for the last week of our honeymoon having toured around Europe and stayed in some fabulous hotels for the first two weeks. The hotel staff were all lovely and keen to make our stay enjoyable unfortunately the location was poor. The beach is dirty and crowded and the party boats are not conducive with a honeymoon! If you like good food local food you will be disappointed. We walked to the local restaurants described as 'the strip' there was nothing local about them! Plenty of neon and karaoke if you’re into that kind of thing and unfortunately there is nowhere else to eat except the hotel restaurant. The spa facilities were very nice but not really adequate to warrant the description of 'spa hotel' we were told that they could not fit us in for a massage for four days!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the location

reviews.text: This is at its best a 3 star hotel. I thought of starting legal procedures against the Small Luxury Hotels of the World, for misleading people in thinking this is a luxury property. The word luxury should not be associated with this hotel. The accomodation is cheaply done and the service is three stars.The girls are rude, all untrained polish girls who know little about hotels or service. The prices of the food are the only thing that are five star and above...for no reason. I will definitely try to get some compensation from the association of small luxury hotels who seem to be selling nothing special or a lot of money.
reviews.title: Disappointing and not five star
a wonderful experience
reviews.text: We have just returned from the Thalassa hotel where we spent seven of the most relaxing days ever! The staff were just marvellous. They tended to our every need. The pool attendant, as described by others, was simply the best. He was always there to help you move your sunbed or to move your sun umbrella so that you could stay out of the sun with very little effort. So much more relaxing without children too. Drinks were served at regualr intervals and the restaurant staff were very well trained. Altogether an unforgettable experience for all the right reasons. Thank you Thalassa!

description: Thalassa Boutique Hotel & Spa. A definitive landmark among Europe’s finest Hotels and a member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the world, Thalassa is distinguished as the ultimate destination for an intimate, luxurious escape immersed in relaxation and rejuvenation. Location: Quietly nestled on the Maa Peninsula, an ancient Greek archeological site and surrounded by the crystal waters of the Mediterranean, Thalassa overlooks the beautiful golden beach of the Coral Bay where the radiance of the setting sun has mesmerized guests with majestic beauty and tranquility. The property borders the Akamas National Park, an area of outstanding natural beauty, and ecological significance, which is protected by UNESCO and also encompasses the endangered turtle breeding site of Lara Bay. Lobby: The moment one enters the gracefully designed Lobby with breathtaking views, the mood set for a never to be forgotten experience. The Sunset Lounge: Enjoy light fare, or traditional afternoon tea amid the splendor of a lovely sitting room atmosphere in our Sunset Lounge. Gaze past the balcony doors and enjoy the sun setting over the colorful horizon. Accommodation: All guests are pampered and offered personalized service from attentive staff in beautifully designed elegant accommodations, all with sea view. Every room is as chic as it appears and includes; full marble bathroom, certain suites even include Whirlpools and personal saunas, lavish bathroom amenities, balcony, IDD cordless telephone set, internet access, satellite TV, Hi FI- DVD system, mini bar, and electronic safe to name a few. The deluxe one-bedroom suite goes as far as to offer his & hers bathrooms with his & hers exclusive amenities. Anagenisis Spa (Salus per Aquam – Healing Through Water): Anagenisis Spa at Thalassa is the first holistic spa in Cyprus. The spa features an array of signature treatments inspired by the four corners of the earth and from the past of ancient Greece. The spa reflects our philosophy of complete serenity and relaxation while highly qualified therapists offer personalized service focusing on the guests' individual wants and needs.
